title: Fugue
description: One of the men has lost his mind and, in a fit of madness, killed two brothers. The settlement is in shock, and tensions are high. Justice must be served, but what form should it take?

options.text: Beck - He wasn’t in his right mind! We don’t throw people away like this. With time, therapy, and care, he might recover. We need to help him, not destroy him.
options.outcome: The man is given a chance at rehabilitation. Some see this as mercy, others as weakness. He shows signs of improvement, but trust in leadership wavers.

options.text: Old-Timer - We can’t risk it happening again. Lock him up where he can’t hurt anyone. It’s the only way to keep the settlement safe.
options.outcome: The man is imprisoned, removing the immediate threat. The community feels safer, but some argue it’s a waste of resources to keep him alive.

options.text: Shady - This is simple. We make an example of him. If people know the price of madness is death, they’ll think twice before losing control.
options.outcome: The man is executed publicly. Fear keeps the people in line, but a shadow of brutality falls over the settlement.
